lines.text: From now on, nothing goes down unless I'm involved. No blackjack no dope deals, no nothing. A nickel bag gets sold in the park, I want in. You guys got fat while everybody starved on the street. Now it's my turn.

[after Jump and Test-Tube have "paid" for a shipment of cocaine with a suitcase full of... tampons!]
What the fuck is this?

[pulling a pair of semi-autos from his jacket]
They're for the bullet holes, puta!
[He blows Tito away]

When the D.A's office investigated the sudden death of Arty Clay, they found that he left a $13 million estate. How do you explain that? There there's Larry Wong, who owned half of Chinatown when he passed away. Larry used to rent his tenements to Asian refuges, his own people, for $800 a month to share a single toilet on the same floor. How 'bout King Tito? He had thirteen-year-old girls hooking for him on the street. Those guys are dead because I don't want to make money that way. Emil Zappa, the Mata brothers, they're dead because they were running this city into the ground.
You expected to get away with killing all these people?
I spent half my life in prison. I never got away with anything, and I never killed anybody that didn't deserve it.
Who made you judge and jury?
Well, it's a tough job, but somebody's got to do it.
He's a fucking glitter-boy! He's looking to get sprayed, laid, played, and slayed. You know what I'm saying?
I heard that.

[to Gilley before he kills him]
Hey. You.

You think ambushing me in some nightclub's gonna stop what makes people take drugs? This country spends $100 billion a year on getting high, and it's not because of me. All that time I was wasting in jail, it just got worse. I'm not your problem. I'm just a businessman.
Yo, congratulations, Frank. Congratulations, man. Them Columbian motherfuckers, they took permanent vacation in hell, if you know what I mean.
Well, I must've been away too long because my feelings are dead. I feel no remorse.
I wanna know who I'm selling drugs to, you know what I mean?
You don't sell drugs, my brother. You shoot people.
Yo, I'm unemployed. Ain't nobody left.
I heard a rumor about you.
What's that?
I heard you got AIDS getting dicked up your ass in prison. That's what I heard.
I thought about you every time I jerked off, dickhead.
How come you never came to see me?
Who wanted to see you in a cage, man?

[as he enters a hotel room and proceeds to gun down King Tito and Company]
... ROOM SERVICE, MOTHERFUCKERS!
[Frank is taking a woman hostage]
You can't hide behind her forever.
I don't need forever!
There are some things I don't do.
I've got a $250,000 contract on any cop involved with this case.
Do you really expect to get away with killing all these people?
I never killed anybody who didn't deserve it.
I thought people like you didn't believe in the legal process.
I thought people like me were the legal process.
Who made you judge and jury.
It's a tough job but someone's got to do it.

[to Bishop]
I'm not your problem. I'm a business man.
I've got a message from Frank White. He wants to sit down, he wants to talk.
You tell him I don't talk to nigger lovers.
Well, he says he's got things on his mind that he wants to discuss with you, and he wants to know where and he wants to know when.
You tell him in fucking Hell, that's where. He's gonna wish his lawyer left him fucking those Sambos in the joint when I get through with him.
Frank's Park-Avenue attorney can get him out in TEN MINUTES! TEN MINUTES later, he's back on the street again. There's only one way to get Frank.
So... what? Are you going to shoot everybody you can't arrest?
We can make it look like a rival gang.
Hey, scumbag, guess what? You're under a-fuckin'-rrest!

[pulls down pants exposing his bare butt to Bishop, Gilley and Flanigan]
Why don't you kiss my ass?
Frank White. I've heard a lot about you. And it's all bad.
Don't believe everything that Pete writes in the columns.
What can we expect from the "reformed" Frank White?
I'm gonna run for mayor!
How's the family?
Better then when you left. They're all working. My son is back from college. What about you?
Back from the dead!
